Sentencas: A dense electrolyte with a relative density of over 95% is vital to prevent gas leakage and thus the achievement of high open circuit voltage in solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: Lowering the sintering temperature of solid oxide fuel cell electrolytes by infiltration

Sentencas: The densification process of ceria based electrolyte requires high temperatures heat treatment (i.e. 1400-1500 degrees C).
Titulo: Lowering the sintering temperature of solid oxide fuel cell electrolytes by infiltration

Sentencas: Thus, the minimum co-sintering temperatures of the anode-electrode bilayers are fixed at these values, resulting in coarse anode microstructures and consequently poor performance.
Titulo: Lowering the sintering temperature of solid oxide fuel cell electrolytes by infiltration

Sentencas: The main purpose of this study is to densify gadolinia doped ceria (GDC), a common SOFC electrolyte, at temperatures lower than 1400 degrees C.
Titulo: Lowering the sintering temperature of solid oxide fuel cell electrolytes by infiltration

Sentencas: By this aim, an approach involving the infiltration of polymeric precursors into porous electrolyte scaffolds, a method commonly used for composite SOFC electrodes, is proposed.
Titulo: Lowering the sintering temperature of solid oxide fuel cell electrolytes by infiltration

Sentencas: By infiltrating polymeric precursors of GDC into porous GDC scaffolds, a reduction in the sintering temperature by at least 200 degrees C is achieved with no additives that might affect the electrical properties.
Titulo: Lowering the sintering temperature of solid oxide fuel cell electrolytes by infiltration

Sentencas: Energy dispersive x-ray spectroscopy line scan analyses performed on porous GDC scaffolds infiltrated by a marker solution (polymeric FeOx precursor in this case) reveals a homogeneous infiltrated phase distribution, demonstrating the effectiveness of polymeric precursors.
Titulo: Lowering the sintering temperature of solid oxide fuel cell electrolytes by infiltration
